page.title: 02Events
page.content: The Scanner Bonanza was held in the Blyth Hall in Newport on Saturday, 8th. June.It was held in aid of the C.A.T. Scan Appeal.(C.A.T. stands for Computer Assisted Tomography.) The money raised, which was Â£3224, will go towards getting a C.A.T. scan machine for Tayside. The machine is mainly used for looking for cancer in the early stages, so that it can be treated. The Coffee Morning lasted for two hours and some of the stalls were; tombola, raffle, treasure hunt and buzz, cake and candy, the Forgan Arts Centre Plant Stall and the pancake stall. As well as that, upstairs, there was a coffee room which had a large queue. There was also a drawing and painting competition for the children; the theme was cats.
